content.description:
In the little cave formed between the LV deadpoint and the art boulders is a traverse that has some chipped holds on it.  I assume whoever chipped the holds did the problem.  No idea on the grade, I've never felt like climbing it (Mtn project wouldn't let me post without a grade so i put v-easy) 

  Looks like you''d start sitting and do a low traverse right and then top out on the tall face around the corner. 

  This boulder should not be an example for the ethic of the area and chipping is more than highly frowned upon.
content.location: Cave between LV deadpoint boulder and Art boulder

content.description: Try not to drop too wildly out of this one or Art school won't be the largest of your problems.  On the same face as the rock art, but to the far right side.  You shouldn't be near the art if you're on this line.  Starts high on sloped edges/pinches (step down from boulder behind you if needed) and moves straight up on slopers before a jump straight up to a good, flat slot.  The line isn't actually that dangerous with a pad on the boulder behind you and a spot, it's just not advised to dyno wildly with the sharp edge of the boulder behind you.  Top out straight up or to the right.
content.protection: Pads, spot on the boulder behind you.
content.location: On the face to the right of the art.  I think this is the North face.  It's usually pretty shady

content.description:
On the left side of the uphill facing side of the boulder.  Start on edges to the right of the arete, trends up and leftwards through small crimps.   

  Beautiful tall line, kind of silver and shiny in the right lighting.
content.location: On the left side of the uphill facing side of the boulder, right of the arete

content.description:
One of the first boulders as you head up the hill off the trail.  This is a very obvious, large, beautiful boulder.  It probably had another name at some point but with the obscurity of information for linda vista I decided to post it as the art boulder since it has rock art on it. 

  On that note: do not climb on or near the part of the boulder that contains rock art.  That should go without saying.  There is a problem on the face to the right of the art, if you're starting it correctly you will be too far away to be near the art with any of your limbs.
